alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 6:25PM EDT until March 27 at 7:41AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet, Significant flooding expands into the woodlands along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow almost triples in volume compared to the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 18 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM EDT Sunday was 18 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.6 feet late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
